intro: Atriplex flexuosa, commonly known as desert saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, aiding in its survival in dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically appearing in late spring to early summer. Its salt-tolerant nature allows it to thrive in soils with high salinity. Atriplex flexuosa plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife.
